thread.title: Police say alleged rape of woman who was abducted with her toddler from seaside 'not as first reported'
thread.title_full: Police say alleged rape of woman who was abducted with her toddler from seaside 'not as first reported'

author: Chris kitching
title: Police say alleged rape of woman who was abducted with her toddler from seaside 'not as first reported'
text:
News Police say alleged rape of woman who was abducted with her toddler from seaside 'not as first reported' Detectives say they are no longer looking for two men in connection with the incident in Redcar on Friday Share Police say the woman and her toddler were held for hours (Photo: Evening Gazette) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Police investigating the alleged rape of a woman who was abducted with her toddler from a beachfront have revealed the allegation is not as first reported. 
Detectives say they are no longer looking for two men in connection with the incident in Redcar on Friday. 
A spokesman for Cleveland Police told Gazette Live : "As a result of police inquiries, officers have established that the circumstances surrounding a report of rape in Redcar on Friday 3rd March are not as first reported and officers are no longer looking for two men that forced a woman and her child into a vehicle on Redcar sea front. 
“Inquiries are ongoing into an allegation of rape involving people who may have been known to each other. 
“Anyone who may have seen a woman with a toddler between the area of Roseberry Road and Larkswood Road in Redcar between 4pm and 6pm or anyone with private CCTV footage covering the area at that time is asked to contact Cleveland Police on 101.” 
Police had arrested a 31-year-old man after the "horrific" rape of the mum and he was later released without charge. 
It was alleged that the woman, who is in her 30s, was held for up to seven hours after she and her child were snatched from the Redcar seafront on Friday. 
Senior Investigating Officer Detective Chief Inspector Steve Young Police said earlier in the weel that the woman was subjected to a "very serious and horrific rape" by two male suspects before she was forced out of the car. 
Detectives made a public appeal for witnesses on Monday at the spot where the alleged abduction took place, saying the area was busy at the time of the incident and it's likely that people saw or heard something that could assist police . (Photo: Evening Gazette) (Photo: PA) 
Cleveland Police would not confirm the age or gender of the child, who was not harmed. 
Earlier in the week DCI Young told reporters that the woman screamed for help as she and the toddler were dragged into the car. 
He said the area in Redcar, Teesside, was busy with dog walkers, people on the beach and workers on their lunch break, and "someone must have seen or heard her" as she cried for help. 
DCI Young said police are providing support to the woman and child after the "extremely traumatic" experience. 
He added that police are carrying out "extensive" CCTV enquiries, and they are still investigating whether the woman was targeted or if she knew her attackers. 
The crime has left the community shocked, and police advised residents to be vigilant but to "not become captive in their own homes" as officers hunted the pair who were considered "potentially dangerous". (Photo: Evening Gazette) (Photo: Evening Gazette) (Photo: Evening Gazette) 
Poliice revealed that the time that the woman and her child were on the seafront near to a boating lake when a dark-coloured saloon approached them on a ramp between 11.30am and 12.30pm, said police. 
Two men got out and forced the woman and child into the back of the car before driving off down Turner Street and to Yearby, on Longbeck Lane off the A174, where the woman was raped. 
The mother and toddler were finally released between 5.30pm and 6.30pm, when they were forced out of the car between the turn off for Kirkleatham Museum and the bus stop towards Redcar. 
The woman managed to seek the help of a member of the public. Like us on Facebook
